subject: Organic Chemistry

funder.name: This work was supported by the Medical University of Lodz (grant no. 502-34-011).

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
<jats:p>Hydrolyzable tannins and products of their hydrolysis, ellagic acid (EA) and gallic acid (GA), are important con-stituents of many medicinal plants and exhibit various biological activities. <jats:italic>Geum rivale</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>G. urbanum</jats:italic> are traditional herbal remedies rich in tannin compounds. The aim of the study was to quantitate free and total EA and GA in aerial and underground parts of <jats:italic>G. rivale</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>G. urbanum.</jats:italic> After optimization of extraction, both compounds were quantitated by reversed phase HPLC (RP-HPLC). EA was more abundant than GA in the inves-tigated material, and underground parts of <jats:italic>G. rivale</jats:italic> were the richest source of total EA and GA.</jats:p>
title: Quantitative Determination of Ellagic Acid and Gallic Acid in Geum Rivale L. and G. Urbanum L.
